Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.core.Game
public class Game extends Object
The main class that manages the game lifecycle, including world creation, view rendering, input handling, pause/menu interaction, and game loop timing.

This class serves as the central controller for the platformer game, handling:

  • Game initialization and setup
  • Level progression and management
  • UI components and overlays
  • Game state (pause, resume, save, load)
  • Timing and high score tracking

  • Field Details

    • world

      private GameWorld world
      The game world that handles physics and contains all entities. Each level creates a new GameWorld instance.

    • view

      private GameView view
      The view component responsible for rendering the GameWorld to the screen.

    • frame

      private JFrame frame
      The main application window (a JFrame) that displays the game.

    • gameLoopTimer

      private Timer gameLoopTimer
      A Timer that drives the main game loop, typically running at ~60 frames per second.

    • level

      private int level
      An integer representing the current level. Levels typically start at 1 and increment as the player progresses.

    • layeredPane

      private JLayeredPane layeredPane
      A JLayeredPane that allows multiple overlapping panels or overlays. Used for pause menus, controls overlays, etc.

    • startTime

      private long startTime
      The timestamp (in milliseconds) at which the current level run began.

    • endTime

      private long endTime
      The timestamp (in milliseconds) at which the current level run ended.

    • elapsedTime

      private long elapsedTime
      The net elapsed time (in milliseconds) for the current run, excluding paused intervals.

    • bestTimes

      private static long[] bestTimes
      A static array storing the best times across all levels. Each index corresponds to a different level, and times are in milliseconds.

    • totalPausedTime

      private long totalPausedTime
      The total accumulated time (in milliseconds) spent in a paused state. This is subtracted from the net elapsed time.

    • pauseStart

      private long pauseStart
      The timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the current pause began. If -1, the game is not currently paused.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int level)
      Constructs a Game instance and initializes the world, view, controls, input handling, game loop, and audio.
      Parameters:
      level - The starting level of the game. Typically 1 for a new game, but can be higher for level progression.

  • Method Details

    • progressToNextLevel

      public void progressToNextLevel()
      Progresses to the next level by creating a new Game instance.

      The new instance preserves timer state (start time, paused time) so the overall run timer continues seamlessly.

    • restartLevel

      public void restartLevel()
      Restarts the current level while preserving the timer state.

    • gameCompleted

      public void gameCompleted()
      Called when the final level is completed. Stops the timer, calculates the net active time (excluding pauses), updates the best times, and displays the "Game Complete" screen with the top three times.

    • showPauseOverlay

      public void showPauseOverlay()
      Displays a semi-transparent pause overlay on top of the game.

    • hidePauseOverlay

      public void hidePauseOverlay()
      Removes the pause overlay from the layered pane, returning the user to gameplay.

    • showControlsPanel

      public void showControlsPanel()
      Displays the controls overlay panel on top of the game (MODAL_LAYER).

    • hideControlsPanel

      public void hideControlsPanel()
      Removes the controls overlay panel from the layered pane.

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game by stopping the main loop, pausing physics, and halting background music. Records the pause start time for calculating total paused intervals.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game by restarting the game loop, resuming physics updates, and looping background music. Subtracts the paused interval from the total paused time to maintain correct net elapsed time.

    • getCurrentNetElapsedTime

      public long getCurrentNetElapsedTime()
      Calculates and returns the current net elapsed time, excluding paused intervals.

      This is done by subtracting totalPausedTime and any ongoing pause from the total time since startTime.

      Returns:
      The net elapsed time in milliseconds (excluding pauses).

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state to a file using Java serialization.

      The saved state includes level, health, score, elapsed time, and player position.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame()
      Loads the game state from a file using Java serialization.

      Restores level, health, score, elapsed time, and player position from the saved state.

    • loadGameFromFile

      public static Game loadGameFromFile()
      Static method to load a game from a file without an existing game instance.

      This is typically used when starting the game from a saved state rather than a new game.

      Returns:
      A new Game instance with the loaded state, or null if loading fails.

    • getGameWorld

      public GameWorld getGameWorld()
      Returns the game world instance that contains all game entities and physics.
      Returns:
      The current GameWorld instance.

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Returns the main application window.
      Returns:
      The JFrame instance representing the game window.

    • getBestTimes

      public long[] getBestTimes()
      Returns the array of best times (in milliseconds) across all levels.
      Returns:
      A long[] representing the best times for each level.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point for launching the game.

      Creates and displays the startup screen in the Swing event dispatch thread.

      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used).
